TITLE: There's a 'massive gap' between housing demand and supply in Singapore, PropertyGuru CEO says
SUMMARY: Demand has been on a tear and supply has been constrained, said Hari Krishnan, CEO of PropertyGuru.

TITLE: Judge dismisses Trump federal lawsuit against New York Attorney General Letitia James over her probe of business
SUMMARY: Ex-President Donald Trump and his company are being investigated by New York Attorney General Letitia James over valuations of real estate assets.

TITLE: The Fed will raise interest rates again soon. Make these money moves now
SUMMARY: "If your New Year's resolution was to build a household budget, it may need a refresh and a review," said certified financial planner Cathy Schaeffer.

TITLE: Mansions in Boca Raton are commanding Miami Beach prices. Here's a look inside
SUMMARY: Ultra-high-end real estate in Boca Raton, Florida, is on a stratospheric rise, breaking record sale prices every year for five consecutive years.

TITLE: Home prices have surged. Here's how to tap into that equity if you aren't ready to sell
SUMMARY: Total housing wealth grew by $8.2 trillion between 2010 and 2020, according to a March report from the National Association of Realtors.

TITLE: Home listings suddenly jump as sellers worry they may miss out on the red-hot housing market
SUMMARY: With home sales slowing and mortgage rates rising, home sellers are starting to worry that the red-hot housing market is over.

TITLE: Trump must answer questions under oath in New York AG probe into business practices, appeals court says
SUMMARY: Ex-President Donald Trump has repeatedly failed to limit the probe by New York Attorney General Letitia James into Trump Organization business practices.

TITLE: The lack of small-dollar mortgages is preventing Americans from purchasing affordable homes
SUMMARY: Families on a more modest income are finding it harder to buy smaller houses with smaller mortgages.

TITLE: Mortgage demand slides further, even as interest rates pull back slightly
SUMMARY: Mortgage rates turned lower for the second straight week, according to the Mortgage Bankers Association.

TITLE: That vacation rental listing could be a scam. These are the warning signs to look out for
SUMMARY: As summer heats up, you may be eager to book your next getaway. But before you commit to renting a property, be sure to double check it's not a scam.

TITLE: Sales of newly built homes tumbled over 16% in April while prices soared
SUMMARY: The median price of a new home sold in April was $450,600, an increase of nearly 20% from the year before.

TITLE: Here's why major cities may still be worth their high cost of living
SUMMARY: Cities' longstanding and dominant business advantages have waned in the pandemic but not disappeared amid wide adoption of remote work.

TITLE: Op-ed: The housing shortage will actually benefit homebuilder stocks. Here are some companies to watch
SUMMARY: Rumors of the homebuilding industry's weaknesses have been greatly exaggerated. The current battered condition of these stocks is actually an opportunity.

TITLE: Goldman Sachs expects more China real estate defaults, switches to bear case
SUMMARY: Chinese real estate defaults have increased so much that Goldman Sachs analysts have shifted to their worst-case scenario for the riskiest part of the market.

TITLE: Buyers are making concessions to nab a home. Here’s what they’re doing
SUMMARY: Some 58% of U.S. adults would be willing to take action to find housing that is more affordable, according to a Bankrate survey.

TITLE: What to think about when saving for near-term goals amid choppy markets, rising interest rates
SUMMARY: If you're saving for a goal three to five years away, rising interest rates and liquidity should be top of mind. Here's how to decide where to put that cash.

TITLE: Trump pays $110,000 fine but must do more to lift contempt order, New York AG's office says
SUMMARY: A $10,000 per day fine against Trump could be reinstated if he does not meet the conditions required to lift a contempt-of-court finding.

TITLE: Crypto as currency: managing your financial life using digital coins
SUMMARY: It's possible to live off of a salary paid in cryptocurrency but advisors caution clients virtual coins don't offer the same protections as cash or stocks.

TITLE: Reality TV shows based on real estate are 'horrible' for the industry, says brokerage CEO
SUMMARY: Bess Freedman, CEO of Brown Harris Stevens, took aim at the rise of shows like Netflix's "Selling Sunset" and Bravo's "Million Dollar Listing."

TITLE: Existing home sales fell in April to the lowest level since the start of the pandemic
SUMMARY: Rising mortgage rates and continued tight supply caused home sales to drop to the lowest level since the start of the pandemic.

TITLE: How relocating Americans created new inflation hot spots
SUMMARY: The relationship between migration and inflation has strengthened as more people relocate from expensive cities to more affordable areas, according to Redfin.

TITLE: Scared of getting a mortgage? A strategist reveals the 1990s gadget that gives her cause to be optimistic
SUMMARY: Invesco's Kristina Hooper recalls her own experience of buying a "starter home" as a newlywed in 1996.

TITLE: Americans are more stressed about money than ever, and it's hurting our mental health
Weekly mortgage demand from homebuyers tumbles 12%, as higher interest rates take their toll
SUMMARY: Higher mortgage interest rates are hitting homebuyer affordability hard, and that is showing up in a sharp drop in mortgage applications.

TITLE: How to sidestep a tax bomb when selling your home
SUMMARY: With soaring prices and record home equity, you may expect a profit when selling your property. Here's how to lessen the tax bite.

TITLE: Homebuilder sentiment falls to 2-year low on declining demand and rising costs
SUMMARY: "Housing leads the business cycle, and housing is slowing," said NAHB Chairman Jerry Konter, a builder and developer.

TITLE: Home affordability at 2007 bubble levels, but crash is unlikely: Blackstone's Joe Zidle
SUMMARY: Blackstone's Joseph Zidle draws a striking parallel to the 2007 housing market peak. But, he lists reasons why the outcome should be different this time.

TITLE: Every home in America now has a wildfire threat score, and some areas see a 200% jump in risk
SUMMARY: Wildfire risk is increasing, likely due to global warming, and its destruction is becoming ever more expensive.

TITLE: This flashy Bel Air mansion that was listed at $87.8 million flopped at auction — and now the seller is furious
SUMMARY: "Horrible, Horrible, Horrible!" was how the seller, who filed for Chapter 11 last year, characterized the auction results to CNBC.

TITLE: China may chalk up more debt as lockdowns hit the economy
SUMMARY: China may have to issue more debt as it tries to keep growing in the face of Covid lockdowns that are stunting its economy.
